info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 16 at 6:49PM MST by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...Moderate to heavy snow bands and gusty northerly winds over North- central and portions of Southwest Montana this evening... Moderate to heavy bands of snow and gusty northerly winds will continue to move southward through North-central and Southwestern Montana tonight. Snow rates up to 2 inches per hour can be expected with the heavier bands of snow. The snow intensity should begin to diminish from north to south after midnight, but a lighter variety of snow may persist through the morning hours on Thursday. Variable road conditions including snow packed roads and reduced visibility from blowing and or falling snow should be expected for anyone traveling, especially over the mountain passes and adjacent foothills. Pack a safety kit and make sure your vehicle is in good mechanical shape if you must travel.
